title: Wand of make invisible
data:
| /               |                                                                                           |
| --------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name            | make invisible                                                                            |
| Appearance      | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance")                             |
| Abundance       | [4.5%](/wiki/Wand#Generation "Wand")                                                      |
| Base price      | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                                         |
| Weight          | 7                                                                                         |
| Type            | beam                                                                                      |
| Maximum charges | 8                                                                                         |
| Monster use     | *May be used by monsters as [misc items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item").* |

A **wand of make invisible** is a type of [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") may receive a wand of make invisible as a [miscellaneous item](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item"): if an invisibility item is chosen for that monster's [starting inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory"), it has a 1⁄6 chance of receiving the wand, unless it is not hostile *and* [you](/wiki/You "You") cannot currently [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

[Zapping](/wiki/Zap "Zap") the wand at yourself or a monster will render the target permanently [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible"), unless they are wearing a [mummy wrapping](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping") or are already invisible - zapping a peaceful monster will anger them. Zapping the wand downward will make any [engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") on that [square](/wiki/Square "Square") disappear, as does [engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") with it; this does not auto-identify it. Monsters will use this wand and zap it at themselves to become invisible unless they are wearing a mummy wrapping; peaceful and tame monsters will not do so if you cannot [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").

Turning yourself or a monster invisible with this wand will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") it, as does seeing a monster zap itself.

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") the wand to break it releases a damaging magical blast that has a 9⁄10 chance of turning you invisible for 250 turns, and a 1⁄10 chance of conferring permanent invisibility.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit f83a57c5](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/f83a57c5bf76f1947a26021bd21249b1e2aa57b9), zapping the wand at yourself instead grants 31–45 turns of temporary invisibility.

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility")*

If you do not yet have a method to enter shops, e.g. a mummy wrapping, you might want to keep this wand on hand in case you get a fresh [stalker](/wiki/Stalker "Stalker") corpse or identify a [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") of stalker meat - eating one while already invisible will grant the see invisible [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") and make you permanently invisible (which you already will be if you use the wand). Otherwise, this wand typically has little use if you are already permanently invisible: making your non-steed [pets](/wiki/Pets "Pets") invisible does not give them a combat advantage, and many of the strong spellcasting pets will make themselves invisible anyway if you have see invisible. You may also find a blessed [potion of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility") as your source of the property before a wand of make invisible.

[Floating eyes](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye") are ideal to zap with the wand if you do not yet have a means of preventing or avoiding its [paralyzing](/wiki/Paralyzing "Paralyzing") passive [gaze](/wiki/Gaze "Gaze"), which relies on your ability to see it - pacifists in particular may want the wand to make floating eyes invisible and safe for their pet to kill. The wand can also prove useful in general if you need to get rid of a degraded burnt [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"), which is usually hard to remove otherwise, and can be saved as fodder for [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The wand's temporary invisibility makes it more ideal to use for gaining permanent invisibility and see invisible from eating stalker meat, and the wand in general is more useful for taking advantage of invisibility specifically during combat situations.

## History

The wand of make invisible first appears in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Messages

- \<foo> turns transparent!

  You zapped a monster with a wand of make invisible.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- You feel rather itchy under your \<mummy wrapping>.

  You zapped yourself with the wand, but it was absorbed by a worn mummy wrapping.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the wand of make invisible can [make objects invisible](/wiki/Invisible_item_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Invisible item (SLASH'EM)"), simplifying the process of identifying the wand.

Two wands of make invisible are randomly placed in the open area of [Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold"). The [statue trap](/wiki/Statue_trap "Statue trap") of an [arch-lich](/wiki/Arch-lich "Arch-lich") found in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") contains a wand of make invisible with a single charge. Another wand of make invisible can be found in [The Spider Caves](/wiki/The_Spider_Caves "The Spider Caves").

All of the above information applies to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), wands of make invisible will often be invisible themselves.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2035](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/muse.c#L2035): *peaceful monsters are not generated with invisibility items unless you can see them after use*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 311](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L311)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2390](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L2390)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Wand of make invisible

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
/
Name make invisible
Appearance random
Abundance 4.5%
Base price 150 zm
Weight 7
Type beam
Maximum charges 8
Monster use May be used by monsters as misc items.

A wand of make invisible is a type of wand that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
    • 6.2 GruntHack
  • 7 References

Generation

Randomly generated monsters may receive a wand of make invisible as a miscellaneous item: if an invisibility item is chosen for that monster's starting inventory, it has a 1⁄6 chance of receiving the wand, unless it is not hostile and you cannot currently see invisible.[1]

Description

Zapping the wand at yourself or a monster will render the target permanently invisible, unless they are wearing a mummy wrapping or are already invisible - zapping a peaceful monster will anger them. Zapping the wand downward will make any engraving on that square disappear, as does engraving with it; this does not auto-identify it. Monsters will use this wand and zap it at themselves to become invisible unless they are wearing a mummy wrapping; peaceful and tame monsters will not do so if you cannot see invisible.

Turning yourself or a monster invisible with this wand will auto-identify it, as does seeing a monster zap itself.

Applying the wand to break it releases a damaging magical blast that has a 9⁄10 chance of turning you invisible for 250 turns, and a 1⁄10 chance of conferring permanent invisibility.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

As of commit f83a57c5, zapping the wand at yourself instead grants 31–45 turns of temporary invisibility.

Strategy

Main article: Invisibility

If you do not yet have a method to enter shops, e.g. a mummy wrapping, you might want to keep this wand on hand in case you get a fresh stalker corpse or identify a tin of stalker meat - eating one while already invisible will grant the see invisible intrinsic and make you permanently invisible (which you already will be if you use the wand). Otherwise, this wand typically has little use if you are already permanently invisible: making your non-steed pets invisible does not give them a combat advantage, and many of the strong spellcasting pets will make themselves invisible anyway if you have see invisible. You may also find a blessed potion of invisibility as your source of the property before a wand of make invisible.

Floating eyes are ideal to zap with the wand if you do not yet have a means of preventing or avoiding its paralyzing passive gaze, which relies on your ability to see it - pacifists in particular may want the wand to make floating eyes invisible and safe for their pet to kill. The wand can also prove useful in general if you need to get rid of a degraded burnt Elbereth, which is usually hard to remove otherwise, and can be saved as fodder for polypiling.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The wand's temporary invisibility makes it more ideal to use for gaining permanent invisibility and see invisible from eating stalker meat, and the wand in general is more useful for taking advantage of invisibility specifically during combat situations.

History

The wand of make invisible first appears in Hack 1.0.

Messages

<foo> turns transparent!
You zapped a monster with a wand of make invisible.[2]
You feel rather itchy under your <mummy wrapping>.
You zapped yourself with the wand, but it was absorbed by a worn mummy wrapping.[3]

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the wand of make invisible can make objects invisible, simplifying the process of identifying the wand.

Two wands of make invisible are randomly placed in the open area of Grund's Stronghold. The statue trap of an arch-lich found in the Lawful Quest contains a wand of make invisible with a single charge. Another wand of make invisible can be found in The Spider Caves.

All of the above information applies to SlashTHEM.

GruntHack

In GruntHack, wands of make invisible will often be invisible themselves.

References

  1. ↑ src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2035: peaceful monsters are not generated with invisibility items unless you can see them after use
  2. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 311
  3. ↑ src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2390

{{wand
  |name=make invisible
  |cost=150
  |type=beam
  |maxcharges=8
  |abundance=4.5%
  |muse=misc
}}

A '''wand of make invisible''' is a type of [[wand]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
Randomly generated [[monster]]s may receive a wand of make invisible as a [[miscellaneous item]]: if an invisibility item is chosen for that monster's [[monster starting inventory|starting inventory]], it has a {{frac|6}} chance of receiving the wand, unless it is not hostile ''and'' [[you]] cannot currently [[see invisible]].{{refsrc|src/muse.c|2035|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=peaceful monsters are not generated with invisibility items unless you can see them after use}}

==Description==
[[Zap]]ping the wand at yourself or a monster will render the target permanently [[invisible]], unless they are wearing a [[mummy wrapping]] or are already invisible - zapping a peaceful monster will anger them. Zapping the wand downward will make any [[engraving]] on that [[square]] disappear, as does [[engraving]] with it; this does not auto-identify it. Monsters will use this wand and zap it at themselves to become invisible unless they are wearing a mummy wrapping; peaceful and tame monsters will not do so if you cannot [[see invisible]].

Turning yourself or a monster invisible with this wand will [[auto-identify]] it, as does seeing a monster zap itself. 

[[Apply]]ing the wand to break it releases a damaging magical blast that has a {{frac|9|10}} chance of turning you invisible for 250 turns, and a {{frac|10}} chance of conferring permanent invisibility.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|As of {{commit|f83a57c5bf76f1947a26021bd21249b1e2aa57b9}}, zapping the wand at yourself instead grants {{rn1|15|31}} turns of temporary invisibility.}}

==Strategy==
{{main|Invisibility}}
If you do not yet have a method to enter shops, e.g. a mummy wrapping, you might want to keep this wand on hand in case you get a fresh [[stalker]] corpse or identify a [[tin]] of stalker meat - eating one while already invisible will grant the see invisible [[intrinsic]] and make you permanently invisible (which you already will be if you use the wand). Otherwise, this wand typically has little use if you are already permanently invisible: making your non-steed [[pets]] invisible does not give them a combat advantage, and many of the strong spellcasting pets will make themselves invisible anyway if you have see invisible. You may also find a blessed [[potion of invisibility]] as your source of the property before a wand of make invisible.

[[Floating eye]]s are ideal to zap with the wand if you do not yet have a means of preventing or avoiding its [[paralyzing]] passive [[gaze]], which relies on your ability to see it - pacifists in particular may want the wand to make floating eyes invisible and safe for their pet to kill. The wand can also prove useful in general if you need to get rid of a degraded burnt [[Elbereth]], which is usually hard to remove otherwise, and can be saved as fodder for [[polypiling]].

{{upcoming|3.7.0|The wand's temporary invisibility makes it more ideal to use for gaining permanent invisibility and see invisible from eating stalker meat, and the wand in general is more useful for taking advantage of invisibility specifically during combat situations.}}

==History==
The wand of make invisible first appears in [[Hack 1.0]].

==Messages==
{{message|<foo> turns transparent!|You zapped a monster with a wand of make invisible.{{refsrc|src/zap.c|311|nethack=3.6.7}}}}
{{message|You feel rather itchy under your <mummy wrapping>.|You zapped yourself with the wand, but it was absorbed by a worn mummy wrapping.{{refsrc|src/zap.c|2390|nethack=3.6.7}}}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], the wand of make invisible can [[Invisible item (SLASH'EM)|make objects invisible]], simplifying the process of identifying the wand.

Two wands of make invisible are randomly placed in the open area of [[Grund's Stronghold]]. The [[statue trap]] of an [[arch-lich]] found in the [[Lawful Quest]] contains a wand of make invisible with a single charge. Another wand of make invisible can be found in [[The Spider Caves]].

All of the above information applies to [[SlashTHEM]].

===GruntHack===
In [[GruntHack]], wands of make invisible will often be invisible themselves.

==References==
